comments.body: What makes the minimum compatible version 3.5? A brief glance looks like this works all the way down to the lowest TS version DefinitelyTyped supports.

I'm not completely sure whether it is [smarter type checking](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-5.html#smarter-union-type-checking) or [better type inference](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-5.html#higher-order-type-inference-from-generic-constructors) or even something else, however, tests for lower TS versions fail with several errors like the following one:
```
ERROR: 12:1  expect  TypeScript@3.4 expected type to be:
  ObserverResultWithoutDefaultSize<HTMLElement>
got:
  ObserverResultWithoutDefaultSize<{}>
```
"Fixing" tests for TS 3.4 and lower breaks them for TS@next. Types since the TS 3.5 seem more precise so I stuck with them.
